com.github.mikephil.charting.charts

Class RadarChart

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • com.github.mikephil.charting.charts.Chart<T>
          • com.github.mikephil.charting.charts.PieRadarChartBase<RadarData>
            • com.github.mikephil.charting.charts.RadarChart
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent, ChartInterface

    public class RadarChart
extends PieRadarChartBase<RadarData>
    Implementation of the RadarChart, a "spidernet"-like chart. It works best when displaying 5-10 entries per DataSet.

      calcualtes the y-min and y-max value and the y-delta and x-delta value

      Returns the factor that is needed to transform values into pixels.

      Returns the xIndex for the given angle around the center of the chart.
      protected float[] getMarkerPosition(Entry e, Highlight highlight)
      Returns the actual position in pixels of the MarkerView for the given Entry in the given DataSet.
      float getRadius()
      Returns the radius of the chart in pixels.
      protected float getRequiredBaseOffset()
      Returns the base offset needed for the chart without calculating the legend size.
      protected float getRequiredLegendOffset()
      Returns the required offset for the chart legend.
      int getSkipWebLineCount()
      Returns the modulus that is used for skipping web-lines.
      float getSliceAngle()
      Returns the angle that each slice in the radar chart occupies.
      int getWebAlpha()
      Returns the alpha value for all web lines.
      int getWebColor() 
      int getWebColorInner()

      float getWebLineWidthInner() 
      XAxis getXAxis()
      Returns the object that represents all x-labels that are placed around the RadarChart.
      YAxis getYAxis()
      Returns the object that represents all y-labels of the RadarChart.
      float getYChartMax()
      Returns the maximum value this chart can display on it's y-axis.
      float getYChartMin()
      Returns the minimum value this chart can display on it's y-axis.
      float getYRange()
      Returns the range of y-values this chart can display.

      initialize all paints and stuff
      void notifyDataSetChanged()
      Lets the chart know its underlying data has changed and performs all necessary recalculations.
      protected void onDraw(android.graphics.Canvas canvas) 
      void setDrawWeb(boolean enabled)
      If set to true, drawing the web is enabled, if set to false, drawing the whole web is disabled.
      void setSkipWebLineCount(int count)
      Sets the number of web-lines that should be skipped on chart web before the next one is drawn.
      void setWebAlpha(int alpha)
      Sets the transparency (alpha) value for all web lines, default: 150, 255 = 100% opaque, 0 = 100% transparent
      void setWebColor(int color)
      Sets the color for the web lines that come from the center.
      void setWebColorInner(int color)
      Sets the color for the web lines in between the lines that come from the center.
      void setWebLineWidth(float width)
      Sets the width of the web lines that come from the center.
      void setWebLineWidthInner(float width)
      Sets the width of the web lines that are in between the lines coming from the center.

      • notifyDataSetChanged

        public void notifyDataSetChanged()
        Description copied from class: Chart
        Lets the chart know its underlying data has changed and performs all necessary recalculations. It is crucial that this method is called everytime data is changed dynamically. Not calling this method can lead to crashes or unexpected behaviour.
        Overrides:
        notifyDataSetChanged in class PieRadarChartBase<RadarData>

      • setDrawWeb

        public void setDrawWeb(boolean enabled)
        If set to true, drawing the web is enabled, if set to false, drawing the whole web is disabled. Default: true
        Parameters:
        enabled -

      • setSkipWebLineCount

        public void setSkipWebLineCount(int count)
        Sets the number of web-lines that should be skipped on chart web before the next one is drawn. This targets the lines that come from the center of the RadarChart.
        Parameters:
        count - if count = 1 -> 1 line is skipped in between
